info.name: JSONPlaceholder
info.description:
# üîç Get started here

This collection template is a blueprint demonstrating the core features of a search REST API, like searching for results, autocomplete, and fetching popular queries. You can use this template as inspiration to build your custom API or extend it to work with one you've already started working on.

## üîñ How to use this template?

#### **Step 1: Send the requests**

Send the requests and view the response returned by the mock API, or check out the examples included.

We recommend you run the requests in this order to explore the collection and get a hang of the different endpoints without running into any hiccups:

`Popular ‚Üí Search ‚Üí Autocomplete ‚Üí Filter ‚Üí Related`

#### Step 2: Update the base URL

Select the collection and navigate to the Variables tab. Update the `base_url` variable with your API's URL.

#### **Step 2: Customize the requests**

Update the requests to suit your use case, including the query parameters, authorization, documentation, headers, tests, and path parameters.

#### **Step 4: Continue building the collection**

Create requests in this collection to test the new API endpoints you develop.

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Resources

[Building requests](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/requests/)  
[Authorizing requests](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/)  
[Using variables](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/)  
[Creating your first collection](https://learning.postman.com/docs/getting-started/creating-the-first-collection/)

query.description: The search query string
The page number to retrieve
The maximum number of results per page
The sorting option for the results
The sorting order for the results

request.description: Perform a search and retrieve results based on specified criteria such as limit, page number, sorting options.

response.name: Search

query.description: The search query string
The page number to retrieve
The maximum number of results per page
The sorting option for the results
The sorting order for the results

response.body:
{
  "results": [
    {
      "id": "shoe-1",
      "title": "Running Shoes",
      "description": "These running shoes are designed for comfort and performance.",
      "brand": "Nike",
      "category": "Running",
      "url": "https://example.com/shoes/running/1",
      "imageUrl": "https://example.com/images/running-shoes.jpg"
    },
    {
      "id": "shoe-2",
      "title": "Basketball Shoes",
      "description": "These basketball shoes provide excellent traction and support on the court.",
      "brand": "Adidas",
      "category": "Basketball",
      "url": "https://example.com/shoes/basketball/1",
      "imageUrl": "https://example.com/images/basketball-shoes.jpg"
    },
    {
      "id": "shoe-3",
      "title": "Casual Sneakers",
      "description": "These casual sneakers are perfect for everyday wear.",
      "brand": "Puma",
      "category": "Casual",
      "url": "https://example.com/shoes/casual/1",
      "imageUrl": "https://example.com/images/casual-sneakers.jpg"
    }
  ]
}
